bibl.title: Letter from Bertha L. Lyons to Philip Showalter Hench, March 15, 1948

div1.p: Lyons writes that Lawrence Reed has suggested that the Hall of Fame program include an image of Lemuel Reed's parsonage. She asks if Hench has a photo.

div1.head: Letter from Bertha L. Lyons to Philip Showalter Hench, March 15, 1948
div1.opener:
Every American is a shareholder in the Hall of Fame
HALL OF FAME : NEW YORK UNIVERSITY
I MADISON AVENUE · NEW YORK IO, N. Y.
Telephone: MURRAY HILL 3-4469
15 March 1948
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
We have had a letter from General Reed this morn-
ing suggesting that we reproduce in the program the wood
parsonage which was the residence of Walter Reed's father.
Do you happen to have a photograph of this dwelling? I do
not recall having seen it in any of the biographies which
I read concerning Reed. If you do not happen to have the
photograph, would you be good enough to let me know where
I might obtain one. I am assuming that General Reed has
turned over all of the papers relating to his family to you.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Bertha L. Lyons
Assistant to the Director BLL:yz
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
